description.narrative:
CISU's Civil Society Fund supports efforts carried out in cooperation between Danish organizations and their partners and others actors in developing countries. The efforts of the Civil Society Pool makes a popular contribution to Danish development assistance. The civil society pool supports cooperation between one diversity of actors to achieve: • Sustainable improvements in the living conditions of poor people, societal participation, fulfillment of rights and ensuring equal opportunities. • Strong, independent and diverse civil society through efforts at all levels, from local organization to global cooperation. • A strong popular and voluntary commitment to the Danish language development cooperation by Danes being directly involved in development cooperation and in the fulfillment of the UN World goals. In this way, the Civil Society Pool contributes to making the poor and vulnerable groups able to work on improvements themselves of the matters which they consider important, relevant and necessary, and which are structurally and in the longer term helping to improve their living conditions in the community locally, nationally and globally.
CISU Covid-19 2020-2023: The purpose is to strengthen resilient and independent civil societies in the Global South, which has experienced a shrinking civic space, violations on human rights, rights at work, as well as disproportionate restrictions as an effect of the COVID-19 pandemic.
CISU Engagement Fund: Contribute to engaging people in development cooperation in the widest sense possible by creating a framework of opportunities for action and joint solutions towards a world with social justice and responsible climate and environmental conduct, including contribute to increasing knowledge and understanding of conditions in developing countries and UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). This may take the shape of local, national or international initiatives.
More here: https://www.cisu.dk/om-cisu/om-cisu-civilsamfund
The purpose is to build strong resilient and independent civil societies in the Global South. This project holds pool grants for CISU , since 2019.
